spreadsheet.SpreadsheetApp.name: SpreadsheetApp
spreadsheet.SpreadsheetApp.doc: SpreadsheetApp This class allows users to open Google Sheets files and to create new ones. This class is the parent class for the Spreadsheet service.

property.name: DataValidationCriteria
property.doc: An enumeration representing the data-validation criteria that can be set on a range.

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates a new spreadsheet with the given name.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name for the spreadsheet

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates a new spreadsheet with the given name and the specified number of rows and columns.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name for the spreadsheet

argument.name: rows
argument.doc: the number of rows for the spreadsheet

argument.name: columns
argument.doc: the number of columns for the spreadsheet

method.name: flush
method.doc: Applies all pending Spreadsheet changes.

method.name: getActive
method.doc: Returns the currently active spreadsheet, or null if there is none.

method.name: getActiveRange
method.doc: Returns the range of cells that is currently considered active.

method.name: getActiveSpreadsheet

method.name: getUi

spreadsheet.ContainerInfo.name: ContainerInfo
spreadsheet.ContainerInfo.doc: ContainerInfo The chart's position within a sheet. Can be updated using the EmbeddedChart.modify() function. chart = chart.modify().setPosition(5, 5, 0, 0).build(); sheet.updateChart(chart);

method.name: getAnchorColumn
method.doc: The chart's left side will be anchored in this column.

method.name: getAnchorRow
method.doc: The chart's top side will be anchored in this row.

method.name: getOffsetX
method.doc: The chart's upper left hand corner will be offset from the anchor column by this many pixels.

method.name: getOffsetY
method.doc: Chart's upper left hand corner will be offset from the anchor row by this many pixels.

spreadsheet.DataValidation.name: DataValidation
spreadsheet.DataValidation.doc: DataValidation This class allows users to access existing data-validation rules. To create a new rule, see SpreadsheetApp.newDataValidation(), DataValidationBuilder, and Range.setDataValidation(rule). // Log information about the data-validation rule for cell A1. var cell = SpreadsheetApp.getActive().getRange('A1'); var rule = cell.getDataValidation(); if (rule != null) { var criteria = rule.getCriteriaType(); var args = rule.getCriteriaValues(); Logger.log('The data-validation rule is %s %s', criteria, args); } else { Logger.log('The cell does not have a data-validation rule.') }

method.name: copy
method.doc: Creates a builder for a data-validation rule based on this rule's settings.

method.name: getAllowInvalid
method.doc: Returns true if the rule shows a warning when input fails data validation, or false if it rejects the input entirely.

method.name: getCriteriaType
method.doc: Gets the rule's criteria type as defined in the DataValidationCriteria enum.

method.name: getCriteriaValues
method.doc: Gets an array of arguments for the rule's criteria.

method.name: getHelpText
method.doc: Gets the rule's help text, or null if no help text is set.

spreadsheet.DataValidationBuilder.name: DataValidationBuilder
spreadsheet.DataValidationBuilder.doc: DataValidationBuilder Builder for data-validation rules. // Set the data validation for cell A1 to require a value from B1:B10. var cell = SpreadsheetApp.getActive().getRange('A1'); var range = SpreadsheetApp.getActive().getRange('B1:B10'); var rule = SpreadsheetApp.newDataValidation().requireValueInRange(range).build(); cell.setDataValidation(rule);

spreadsheet.EmbeddedChart.name: EmbeddedChart
spreadsheet.EmbeddedChart.doc: EmbeddedChart Represents a chart that has been embedded into a Spreadsheet. This example shows how to modify an existing chart: var sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSheet(); var range = sheet.getRange("A2:B8") var chart = sheet.getCharts()[0]; chart = chart.modify() .addRange(range) .setOption('title', 'Updated!') .setOption('animation.duration', 500) .setPosition(2,2,0,0) .build(); sheet.updateChart(chart); This example shows how to create a new chart: function newChart(range, sheet) { var sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSheet(); var chartBuilder = sheet.newChart(); chartBuilder.addRange(range) .setChartType(Charts.ChartType.LINE) .setOption('title', 'My Line Chart!'); sheet.insertChart(chartBuilder.build()); }

spreadsheet.DataValidationCriteria.name: DataValidationCriteria
spreadsheet.DataValidationCriteria.doc: DataValidationCriteria An enumeration representing the data-validation criteria that can be set on a range. // Change existing data-validation rules that require a date in 2013 to require a date in 2014. var oldDates = [new Date('1/1/2013'), new Date('12/31/2013')]; var newDates = [new Date('1/1/2014'), new Date('12/31/2014')]; var sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSheet(); var range = sheet.getRange(1, 1, sheet.getMaxRows(), sheet.getMaxColumns()); var rules = range.getDataValidations(); for (var i = 0; i < rules.length; i++) { for (var j = 0; j < rules[i].length; j++) { var rule = rules[i][j]; if (rule != null) { var criteria = rule.getCriteriaType(); var args = rule.getCriteriaValues(); if (criteria == SpreadsheetApp.DataValidationCriteria.DATE_BETWEEN && args[0].getTime() == oldDates[0].getTime() && args[1].getTime() == oldDates[1].getTime()) { // Create a builder from the existing rule, then change the dates. rules[i][j] = rule.copy().withCriteria(criteria, newDates).build(); } } } } range.setDataValidations(rules);
